biography.value:
The Negative Plane is a place of death, anathema to all living things. Yet there are some who would tap into its fell power and use its energy for sinister ends. Most individuals prove unequal to the task. Those not destroyed outright are sometimes drawn inside the plane and replaced by nightwalkers—terrifying Undead creatures that devour all life they encounter.

One can reach the Negative Plane from the Shadowfell in places where the barrier between the planes is thin. Stepping onto the Negative Plane is almost always fatal since the plane sucks the life and soul from creatures, annihilating most at once. The few who survive by sheer luck or by harnessing some rare form of protective magic soon discover that they can’t leave as easily as they arrived.

Worse, for each creature that enters the plane, a nightwalker is released to take its place. In order for a trapped creature to escape, the released nightwalker must be lured back to the Negative Plane by offerings of life for it to devour. If the nightwalker is destroyed, the trapped creature has no hope of escape.

Generally, a nightwalker on the Material Plane is attracted to elements of the world associated with the creature responsible for its creation, which can provide clues as to who the trapped creature is. This attraction doesn’t indicate a willingness to engage with the world, though; nightwalkers exist to make life extinct, and they prioritize anything associated with the trapped creature for destruction.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The nightwalker makes two Enervating Focus attacks, one of which can be replaced by Finger of Doom, if available.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 5d8 + @mod type=necrotic average=true]] damage. The target must succeed on a [[/save con 21 format=long]] or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the &Reference[necrotic]{necrotic} damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The nightwalker points at one creature it can see within 300 feet of it. The target must succeed on a [[/save wis 21 format=long]] or take [[/damage 6d12 type=necrotic average=true]] damage and become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} until the end of the nightwalker’s next turn. While &Reference[frightened]{frightened} in this way, the creature is also &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed}. If a target’s saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the nightwalker’s Finger of Doom for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Annihilating Aura. Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the nightwalker must succeed on a [[/save con 21 format=long]] or take [[/damage 6d6 type=necrotic average=true]] damage. &Reference[undead]{Undead} are immune to this aura.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Life Eater. A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by the nightwalker and can’t be revived except by a wish spell.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Unusual &Reference[nat]{Nature}. The nightwalker doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
